attributes.comment:
My husband and I are pursueing an international adoption. We are concerned
about your proposal to raise fees regarding international adoption. We feel the
high costs of adoption are already quite prohibitive. An increase in these already
large fees would be a burdon to those who seek to assist the orphan. While we
are more than willing to make necessary sacrifices, there are likely other areas
you could look at to improve your budget, such as looking at reducing your costs.
For example, we sent our packet in for fingerprinting, and it was returned IN FULL
because we accidentally sent $1 too much for the fee. Would it not have been
more cost effective to send us a dollar and proceed with our application-or keep
the dollar for yourself (we wouldn't of cared)? We voice our concern not just for
ourselves (our fee has already been paid), but for the other parents seeking
international adoption and for the orphans. Please do not approve docket number
USCIS-2006- 0044 being presented by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.
Thank you,
Karen Gabrielson

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Karen Gabrielson
